intro: Nonea philistaea, commonly known as the Philistine Nonea, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing shrub that typically reaches a height of about 30 centimeters. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid conditions. Nonea philistaea is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought and heat.
